text:
Long time lurker here, I really love this community! So much interesting projects and questions.

I am Kai (@kai_richard) from @Bitspark we build a visual programming language (nocode) which makes heavy use of golang channels. We are looking for use cases and testers and are in need for some help.

Check it out at <https://bitspark.de/slang/> and <https://twitter.com/bitspark> to what we are working on.

We also use DO Kubernetes, Postgres and Redis plus a few Droplets running OpenResty to power the entire platform.

Feedback would be much appreciated.

text: This is very cool. Reminds me of TouchDesignerPro if it wasn’t aimed at DJs. I find it surprising that I can’t drag operators onto the canvas. Also the organization of operators is surprising. I was looking for conversion under `convert`  but it was under `data` . Also I’m getting some crashes. I’d like to compose operators into new operators, but it’s not clear how/whether I can do that. I should probably read the docs.

text: I just peeked at bitspark. A huge amount of work in that product. I looked at the code, very cleverly obfuscated. Was more than surprised to find Maltese strings inside the program, clearly the work of someone from that tiny island. First time in fact i have seen Maltese. Words like xahar Għada means Tomorrow month. The h with a bar is not a common letter!.

text:
<@U6KQ2S410> awe man.. that’s not good news if you cannot tell from the landing page.
This is a product for non-developers to become a developers holistic approach at building workflows, apps and tools through a strong nit community, heavily abstracted code and lego-blocks style development. No more terminal, infra, git, devops, containers, serverless, blah blah blah. 100% business-logic development.

text: So if I follow... its attacking the problem of the complex tools people have built around code as we know it (terminal, infra, git, ...), but it's keeping code itself. What I'd be curious to know is.. does Storyscript have anything at all to say about issues inherent to code?
